title: 112_s261
content: The Act titled "Federal Employees' Compensation Reform Act of 2011" includes reforms for federal workers' compensation for retirement eligible employees. The "Federal Employees' Compensation Reform Act of 2011" includes a provision for the transition to retirement for covered employees eligible for an annuity under chapter 83 or 84 upon attaining retirement age. Payment of compensation under section 8105 or 8106 terminates on the retirement age date. The covered employee's termination is based on reaching retirement age and becoming eligible for an annuity under chapter 83 or 84. The Secretary of Labor must notify the employee, their agency, and the Office of Personnel Management a year before retirement age. The employing agency must apply for an annuity with the Office of Personnel Management. The covered employee's termination is based on reaching retirement age and becoming eligible for an annuity under chapter 83 or 84. A technical and conforming amendment is made to the table of sections for chapter 81 of title 5, United States Code. Employees transitioning from workers compensation must have their employing agency file an application for an annuity with the Office of Personnel Management at least one year before the termination of compensation payments. The term 'covered employee' is defined as an employee eligible for an annuity under this chapter. The Secretary of Labor will prescribe regulations within 180 days of enactment to carry out this Act, which will take effect immediately except for termination of compensation, which will take effect 1 year after regulations are prescribed.
